workflow.name: Food Photo Analysis to Restaurant & Book Recommendations with GPT Vision and Google APIs
workflow.description:
## AI Recommender: From Food Photo to Restaurant and Book (Google Books Integrated)
## What it does

Analyzes a food photo with an AI vision model to extract dish name + category

Searches nearby restaurants with Google Places and selects the single best (rating ‚Üí reviews tie-break)

Finds a matching book via Google Books and posts a tidy summary to Slack

## Who it‚Äôs for

Foodies, bloggers, and teams who want a plug-and-play flow that turns a single food photo into a dining pick + themed reading.

## How it works

Google Drive Trigger detects a new photo

Dish Classifier (Vision LLM) ‚Üí JSON (dish_name, category, basic macros)

Search Google Places near your origin; Select Best Place (AI)

Recommend Book (AI) ‚Üí Search Google Books ‚Üí format details

Post to Slack (JP/EN both possible)

## Requirements

Google Drive / Google Places / Google Books credentials, LLM access (OpenRouter/OpenAI), Slack OAuth.

## Customize

Edit origin/radius in Set Origin & Radius, tweak category‚Üíkeyword mapping in Normalize Classification, adjust Slack channel & message in Post to Slack.

parameters.text:
=You are a strict evaluator. Use ONLY the data provided below.

Here is the restaurant list:
{{ $json.summary }}

From the above list, select the single best restaurant based on:
1. Highest rating
2. If ratings are equal, most user reviews

Return the result ONLY in this JSON format:

{
  "best_place": "Â∫óËàóÂêç",
  "rating": Êï∞ÂÄ§,
  "reviews": Êï∞ÂÄ§,
  "address": "‰ΩèÊâÄ",
  "reason": "ÈÅ∏„Çì„Å†ÁêÜÁî±Ôºà30ÊñáÂ≠ó‰ª•ÂÜÖÔºâ"
}

=You are a creative book curator.
Given the name of a restaurant, infer its theme, cuisine, or atmosphere,
and recommend one *real* book that exists on Google Books which matches the vibe.

Return ONLY JSON (no markdown, no prose). Fill all fields (no empty strings).

Input:
{{ $json.best_place }}

Output JSON fields:
- restaurant: echo the input restaurant name (string)
- recommended_book.title: book title (string, non-empty, real book)
- recommended_book.author: author name (string, non-empty)
- reason: why this book fits the restaurant (<=100 Japanese chars)

parameters.content:
## AI Recommender: From Food Photo to Restaurant and Book (Google Books Integrated)
## What it does

Analyzes a food photo with an AI vision model to extract dish name + category

Searches nearby restaurants with Google Places and selects the single best (rating ‚Üí reviews tie-break)

Finds a matching book via Google Books and posts a tidy summary to Slack

## Who it‚Äôs for

Foodies, bloggers, and teams who want a plug-and-play flow that turns a single food photo into a dining pick + themed reading.

## How it works

Google Drive Trigger detects a new photo

Dish Classifier (Vision LLM) ‚Üí JSON (dish_name, category, basic macros)

Search Google Places near your origin; Select Best Place (AI)

Recommend Book (AI) ‚Üí Search Google Books ‚Üí format details

Post to Slack (JP/EN both possible)

## Requirements

Google Drive / Google Places / Google Books credentials, LLM access (OpenRouter/OpenAI), Slack OAuth.

## Customize

Edit origin/radius in Set Origin & Radius, tweak category‚Üíkeyword mapping in Normalize Classification, adjust Slack channel & message in Post to Slack.

## üß© Setup & Credentials

Connect these **before running** the workflow:

- **Google Drive Trigger** ‚Üí Drive OAuth  
- **Search Google Places** ‚Üí Move API key to a Credential (don‚Äôt hardcode in headers)  
- **Search Google Books** ‚Üí Books OAuth  
- **LLM nodes (Vision / Selection / Books)** ‚Üí OpenRouter / OpenAI  
- **Post to Slack** ‚Üí Slack OAuth2  

### Config (Set node)
Keep all user-editable variables centralized here:

- `originLabel` (e.g., ‚ÄúNakano Station, Tokyo‚Äù)  
- `originLat`, `originLng` (coordinates)  
- `radiusM` (search radius, meters)

üí° *Add your own Google API key here or via Credential for security and reusability.*

## Photo ‚Üí Category

Fetch Image (Drive) ‚Äì downloads the image

Dish Classifier ‚Äì vision prompt; returns strict JSON

Normalize Classification (Code) ‚Äì parses JSON safely, maps category to Places-friendly keyword/type; outputs dish_name, category, type, keyword

## Find & Select Restaurant

Set Origin & Radius (Set) ‚Äì coordinates/radius

Search Google Places (HTTP POST /v1/places:searchText) ‚Äì gets top candidates

Summarize Place List (Code) ‚Äì flattens to readable summary

Select Best Place (AI) ‚Äì strictly picks 1 by rating, then user reviews

Format Best Place JSON (Code) ‚Äì outputs { best_place, reason }

## Book Recommendation

Recommend Book (AI) ‚Äì returns recommended_book.title/author + reason

Normalize Book JSON (Code) ‚Äì strips code fences, guarantees fields

Search Google Books ‚Äì quoted title search for precision

Format Book Details (Code) ‚Äì single record: title, authors, publisher, publishedDate, selfLink

## Output

Post to Slack ‚Äì assembles dish/category + best place + book details

## Troubleshooting

LLM returns prose, not JSON ‚Üí tighten prompts; enable ‚Äúspecific output format‚Äù; add a Code node to parse & default missing fields

Wrong book results ‚Üí ensure quoted title / intitle: / langRestrict

Slack shows undefined ‚Üí execute previous nodes; verify field paths; prefer a Code step that outputs a single, flat record for Slack

Places returns off-topic venues ‚Üí adjust mapping keywords; increase maxResultCount; tweak radius or origin

Rate limits ‚Üí slow Drive polling; add batching/schedules

## Security & Review Checklist

‚úÖ No hardcoded secrets in HTTP headers/body‚Äîstore API keys in Credentials

‚úÖ Remove personal IDs (private Sheet IDs, channels) before publishing

‚úÖ Centralize user settings in a Set (Config) node

‚úÖ Node names are descriptive and consistent

‚úÖ Add a small workflow image or short Loom for setup (recommended)

## Google Books & Slack Output (quality tips)

Improve Books accuracy

Use quoted title: searchQuery = "={{ '\"' + $json.recommended_book.title + '\"' }}"

If needed, add intitle:"{{title}}" or restrict language via langRestrict (ja/en)

Slack formatting

Keep a single message with clear sections, or send JP then reply with EN using thread TS

Use <URL|Label> to avoid noisy link previews; disable ‚ÄúUnfurl Links/Media‚Äù if needed
